result.execSummary:
The defendant Trevor A Henry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevor A Henry

records.addlTxt: Count two.
Count one.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Counts 1, 2:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 

As to Count 1: Defendant ordered to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, credit of 29 days time served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months.

As to Count 2: Defendant ordered to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, credit of 60 days time served, a time served disposition. 

Conditions of Probation
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
- No use or possession of illegal drugs and no alcohol.
- Maintain employment.
- No contact with MF. 
- No further violations of the law.
- Cooperate with agent.
- Pay mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, during term of probation. Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.

Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered charge amended to:
Count 1: Misdemeanor Battery , contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor. 
Count 2: Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), a Class B Misdemeanor.

Defendant Trevor A Henry in court with attorney Eugene James Dietzler.  Defendant Trevor A Henry in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Exp 9/19/2022
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date.

Defendant Trevor A Henry in court by video with Attorney Eugene James Dietzler who appears in person.  Defendant Trevor A Henry in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense objects to the defendant not being produced for todays proceedings. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer B. Czapla. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Defense given a copy, waived reading and requests an arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Arraignment scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Trevor A Henry in court with attorney Eugene James Dietzler.  Defendant Trevor A Henry in custody.  Mark L Thomsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Court in reciept of bail motion and motion to dismiss. Arguments heard as to motion to dismiss. For reasons stated, Court denies motion. State requests an adjourned bail hearing date for purposes of victim notification. Court order case adjourned for bail hearing along with the preliminary hearing, Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion for Reduction of Bail, filed
filed by defense
Received and filed

Defendant Trevor A Henry not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V-LEE hearing in the trial court. Court date provided by Branch 02 clerk. Hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Trevor A Henry not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Trevor A Henry not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for Preliminary hearing. State Public Defenders Office needs more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with M.F. Court advised defendant that failure to comply may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $2,500.00.  If alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Trevor A Henry in court with attorney Kirk D Henley.  Defendant Trevor A Henry in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned to Br. PE.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
